senses.de: Something that is important to you or that you are worried about.
senses.ex: Health and safety is our main concern.

Tips.title: Emotional Weight
Tips.description: Consider 'concern' to express personal importance and a bit of emotional investment.
Tips.example: The issue of privacy is a significant concern for many people.

Tips.title: Not Always Negative
Tips.description: 'Concern' can refer to positive areas of interest, not just worries.
Tips.example: Renewable energy is a key concern in his research.

Tips.title: Varying Intensity
Tips.description: The word can indicate different levels of worry, from mild to substantial.
Tips.example: There's a growing concern about the number of homeless cats.

senses.de: To affect or involve someone or something.
senses.ex: This issue concerns all of us.

Tips.title: Personal Impact
Tips.description: Used as a verb 'concern' highlights personal relevance or effect on people.
Tips.example: Rising costs concern the average consumer.

Tips.title: Broader Context
Tips.description: 'Concern' implies connection to a larger issue or broader subject.
Tips.example: The policy change concerns the entire education system.

senses.ex: He runs a large concern in the city.

Tips.title: Formal Term
Tips.description: In business, 'concern' is a formal way to refer to a company or enterprise.
Tips.example: She invested in a small concern that specializes in organic foods.

Tips.title: Outdated Usage
Tips.description: Referring to a business as 'a concern' may sound old-fashioned or formal.
Tips.example: My grandfather started this concern over sixty years ago.

senses.de: To make someone anxious or upset.
senses.ex: Her lack of response concerns me.

Tips.title: Emotional Disturbance
Tips.description: As a verb, 'concern' means causing one to feel uneasy or anxious.
Tips.example: His strange behavior has really begun to concern me.

Tips.title: Expressing Care
Tips.description: Shows care when one's anxious about someone's well-being.
Tips.example: I'm concerned about you walking home alone at night.

Anxiety.wordDefinition:
Anxiety is a feeling of worry or fear that can be severe and affect your daily life.

It is usually not as intense as anxiety and may involve a desire to take action to address a specific issue.

Both anxiety and concern can arise from various situations, such as financial problems, health issues, or relationships.

However, anxiety can be debilitating and can cause physical symptoms like difficulty breathing, sweating, and rapid heartbeat.

Anxiety is a strong feeling of worry and fear that can affect your life, while concern is a more moderate feeling of worry or interest that can lead to productive actions.

Apprehension.wordDefinition:
The difference between the words apprehension and concern is that apprehension refers to a feeling of fear or anxiety about something that may happen in the future, while concern refers to a feeling of worry or interest in something that is currently happening or may happen in the future.

For example, if you have apprehension about going to a new school, you may feel anxious and fearful about the challenges you may face.

Apprehension is applicable when you have a sense of fear or anxiety about something that may happen in the future, while concern is applicable when you have a feeling of worry or interest in something that is currently happening or may happen in the future.

Care.wordDefinition:
Care means to be worried about someone's well-being and to take actions to help them. For example, if you care about your friend, you'll ask them how they're doing and make sure they're okay.

Concern refers to being interested or involved in something, typically because it affects you or someone you care about.

Care is used more when talking about people, while concern is used more broadly. Both words are important, and they show that you have empathy and an understanding of the world beyond yourself.

Disquiet.wordDefinition:
Concern means to be worried or troubled about something, while disquiet means a feeling of worry or anxiety about something.

Disquiet is applicable when you have a deep sense of unease or discomfort about something, but you may not be able to pinpoint the exact cause or know how to resolve it.

Concern is about worry and action, while disquiet is about a feeling of unease or anxiety without a clear course of action.

Ease.wordDefinition:
Concern means to feel worried or anxious about something, while ease means to feel comfortable or relaxed.

Ease is applicable when you feel comfortable or relaxed. For example, if you are relaxing on the beach on a sunny day, you may feel at ease.

Preoccupation.wordDefinition:
Preoccupation means to be occupied or engrossed in something to the point where it is dominating your thoughts and attention.

For example, if you have a preoccupation with playing video games, it means you are completely focused on playing them and it is taking up a lot of your time.

Concern is a feeling of worry or care while preoccupation is an activity that dominates someone's time and thoughts. Both words can be used in different scenarios.

Solicitude.wordDefinition:
Both concern and solicitude refer to a feeling of care or worry about something or someone.

Solicitude implies a more focused and active form of care. It often involves a sense of responsibility or duty towards the person or thing of concern.

Concern is a broad feeling of worry, while solicitude is a deeper sense of care that involves action and responsibility.

Worry.wordDefinition:
Worry usually refers to something that causes anxiety or fear. For example, you may worry about an upcoming test or a friend's safety.

Concern is an expression of care for something or someone, while worry is a feeling of unease about something.

Concern is often used when you want to make a positive change or help someone, while worry tends to be associated with negative emotions and feeling helpless.

quotes.Text: It is a bit embarrassing to have been concerned with the human problem all one's life and find at the end that one has no more to offer by way of advice than 'try to be a little kinder.
quotes.Title: English Novelist
quotes.Name: Aldous Huxley

quotes.Text: The beauty of love, as far as I'm concerned, is it makes you better. It makes you stronger. It gives you direction. It gives you understanding of what life is and what we've been given.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Jerry Lewis

quotes.Text: My favorite thing in life is writing about life, specifically the parts of life concerning love. Because, as far as I'm concerned, love is absolutely everything.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Taylor Swift

quotes.Text: My grandmother always came to my shows. She was always concerned about the way I dressed - even later on, when I was well known and I supported her.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Al Pacino

quotes.Text: If I feel any marginalisation, it's because the things that concern me aren't so important to other people.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Patti Smith

quotes.Text: John wrote with a very deep love for the human race and a concern for its future.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: Yoko Ono

quotes.Text: You can't let concerns stop you; they drive you and they motivate you.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: John F. Kerry

quotes.Text: You're always concerned for your character. You should be.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: James Callis

quotes.Text: I'm pretty open as far as my personal life is concerned.
quotes.Name: Josh Blue

quotes.Text: As far as I'm concerned, the best acting class is life.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Jake McLaughlin
